text.p: Following are the main stories in Friday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- The government has ordered relevant agencies and public transport companies to come up with solutions to the worsening traffic conditions in Kuala Lumpur in the next two weeks, said Deputy Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.
-- The manufacturing sector strengthened further last year, registering significant jumps in proposed approved investments, said International Trade and Industry Minister Rafidah Aziz.

-- A special committee in Sabah state investigating a log-smuggling operation has found documents purportedly issued by the Primary Industries Ministry authorising the export of logs, said Sabah Deputy Chief Minister Abdul Ghapur Salleh.
-- Insurance policy holders have better and clearer protection under the Insurance Act 1996 which came into force in January 1, said the central bank.
-- Investor confidence in banking stocks remain strong despite the surge in the finance sector in the last six months, analysts said.
